intro: Diplostephium ritterbushii, commonly known as Ritter's bush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in the spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in such climates.
